lines.text:
[about Emma]
I am sorry to lose a good cook, but I will not tolerate a brazen hussy.

[to Emma]
When in my service, walk - never run - it anoys me.

[to Emma]
We never know what destiny has in store for us.

[to Hamilton]
This is the end of your fine plot. I'm not one to be passed around hand to hand.

[to Nelson]
Your love has disgraced her.

[referring to his lost arm and eye]
There's not much left of me. I'm as battered and scarred as my ship.
I think you both the most noble sights my eyes have had the honor to look upon.
You see, my dear, the gods sell everything at a fair price.
England expects every man will do his duty.

[to Nelson]
Horatio, if you go, it is the end.

[to Hardy about Trafalgar]
Today will mean a peerage for me or a tomb in Westminster Abbey.
